Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by suggesting that the image of a person carrying a body with one hand is evidence of the coronavirus being a complete hoax with props and street theater.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide any evidence or data to back up its assertion that the image is proof of a hoax.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the image of a person carrying a body with one hand is not possible or realistic, without considering alternative explanations or circumstances.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim fails to consider the alternative explanation that the image is part of a symbolic funeral procession to protest against the economy reopening without coronavirus relief, as stated by the original caption and news sources.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that more than 387,800 people worldwide have died from COVID-19, according to Johns Hopkins University.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement bias in the provided claim.
Falters at times: There is no evidence of the claim faltering at times bias in the provided claim.
